result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy R Strang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy R Strang

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
Payment info sent to defn at DCJ
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 8/31/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Billy R Strang in court, in custody.  Attorney William Richard Jones in court for Billy R Strang.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. DISM repeater. 6 mo DCJ. State agrees not to issue DA case 22DA7458. Argument. Statement by DE. DNA on file. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM repeater on count 1  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence F/W 

-Days credit for time served:  27 (12/24/21 - 1/5/22 (13), 8/17/22 - 8/30/22 (14))
-Days credit to jail: 27

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Becky K
